result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Andrew Herman

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:20 PM   Defendant in custody.  PFAC denied by the court.  Defendant remains pro se.
Good cause found to toll time limits.  Based on re-review of PFAC, court does find defendant eligible for court appointed counsel.
BAIL MOTION:   Argument by defendant.  Argument by Atty. Barros.  
Court:  Court amends defendant's cash bail from $500 to $2,000 personal recognizance bonds (covering both cases, 22CF600).   All conditions originally ordered remain intact.  Defendant shall have third-party contact with resident at 702 Chicago Street, Manitowoc, WI., but would stay at a friend's house on South 14th Street.  Notify the clerk's office within 24 hours of release as to the address he will be staying at.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled to:  11/10/22, 10:30 a.m., Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney.
DENIED - The Public Defender is still looking for an attorney and it has only been a month.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney;  Affidavit of Indigency.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re: bail modification

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-05-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant requesting bail modification.

2:29 pm - Defendant Paul Andrew Herman appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 09-19-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Paul Andrew Herman
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 09-09-2022)
Prior: 702 Chicago St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Maintain drug trafficking place, on 09-07-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of keeper of drug house and 2 counts felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-12-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Brett Hill, except for 3rd party contact in relation to his tenancy at 702 Chicago Street, Manitowoc, WI; defendant must have no contact with Scott Janquart, except for third party contact in relation to the property at 702 Chicago Street, Manitowoc, WI; defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
